content:
Indigenous musical traditions have been integrated into contemporary Australian music in various ways. One way is through the influence of Indigenous Australian music on genres such as rock, pop, and hip hop. Many contemporary Australian musicians have been inspired by Indigenous music and incorporate elements of it into their compositions.

Another way is through collaborations between Indigenous and non-Indigenous musicians. This has led to the creation of new genres and styles of music that blend traditional Indigenous rhythms and melodies with contemporary Western music.

In addition, Indigenous musicians have been actively involved in preserving their cultural heritage by performing and recording traditional songs and dances. This has helped to educate non-Indigenous Australians about the rich cultural heritage of the Indigenous people and has contributed to the recognition and celebration of Indigenous music.

Furthermore, funding programs and government initiatives have been put in place to support the development of Indigenous Australian music, which has further helped to integrate Indigenous musical traditions into contemporary Australian music.
